item.title: Conferences
item.description: OWASP Global AppSec, Washington DC [Oct 30-31, 2023] - explored Linux memory vulnerabilities with Ofri Ouzan, covering outdated and latest techniques, binary hardening, and real-world examples. - learnt to design secure cloud architecture with Nathan Case, focusing on shared best practices and practical implementation. - discovered the benefits of client-side application layer encryption with Wias Issa for securing cloud data. BSidesNoVA, Northern Virginia [Sep 9, 2023] - attended "Defending Against API Attacks"

item.title: Professional Experiences
item.description: (IBM India Private Ltd.) Software Developer | Jan 2020 - Nov 2021 (~2 Years) - Full Stack Development with skillsets: Angular, Laravel, Spark, Scala, Git, Python - Facilitated to onboard Secret Server for CCA module through cloud - Implemented Authentication and Authorisation feature in CUST-RI (Scala service) - Contributed to Test Driven Development (TDD) on achieving 80% code coverages Skillset: Software Development | Agile Methodologies | Problem Solving (Safer Internet Project) Security Analyst | Nov 2022 - Jun 2023 (8 Months) - Produced professional audit reports and documentation with SIP templates.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Data Model Standardisation using Blockchain This project focused on a smart Hyperledger Fabric-based blockchain network ensuring data model integrity across FMS modules (IBM-SIS) with attribute rules, facilitating consistent and valid database table structures. Tags: hyperledger, rest-api, data-integrity ZeroHunger - Ethereum Blockchain (github) The main goal of this project is to reduce food waste, promote sustainable food systems, distribute food to the needy, and enhance cashless transfers using decentralised blockchain technology.

item.title: Capture the Flags
item.description: Phase 1: TryHackMe (Beginner Friendly) I started my CTF journey on TryHackMe and completed various rooms. Highly recommend it for beginners. Check out my blog for detailed write-ups on different rooms on vasanthvanan.github.io/tryhackme-writeups Currently ranked in the top 1% of the community.

item.title: Certifications
item.description: CompTIA Network+ (verify: Q85MJ88F734119GZ) CompTIA Security+ (verify: QGSWZKZP0DFQ19G3) eLearnSecurity Junior Penetration Tester (eJPT) (verify: 6119394) Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) (verify: ECC1982743650) Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP) (for the future..)

item.title: Thoughts & Notions (Medium)
item.description: As an avid reader and writer on Medium.com, I dedicate ample time exploring latest cybersecurity trends, with a focus on penetration testing. You can find my blog posts on vasanthavanan.medium.com Occasionally, I write blogs at System Weakness Publication. Here are a few blog articles: Encryption : The Art of Cryptography, (December 11, 2017) SS7 — The Deadliest Attack, (February 13, 2019) Inspecting — KrØØk Vulnerability, (March 26, 2020) Injecting 0x113 — Format String Binary Exploitation, (December 15, 2023)
